segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, completely unaware of the water overflowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's just drying a plate, so focused on it like it's the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water is already forming a puddle at her feet, but she doesn't seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be really tired or just lost in thought.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being sneaky, taking cookies from the jar while she's not looking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit worried for the boy on the stool; it looks like it's about to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for her share, totally oblivious to the mess and potential danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it will take for the woman to notice the water or the kids' mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, it's a stark contrast to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope no one gets hurt in this mess.
segments.speaker: PAR
